title: Update On My Situation
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author has not heard back from the New York Times after deleting his blog, but they recently approached an acquaintance for another interview
- Some people are attempting to harass the author by posting his real name on Twitter
- The author is slowly transitioning away from his day job towards starting his own private practice that will focus on medication management
- The author is negotiating details to potentially move to Substack as his blogging platform
- The author has received generous offers from Substack and is considering moving there for added protection and income streams
- The author plans to start blogging again between October and January and would like to maintain his anonymity until then

Key learnings:
- The author is accepting the fact that maintaining anonymity may be a losing battle
- The author is being cautious and thoughtful in his transition away from his day job and towards independent work
- The author is seeking added protection and support from Substack 

Key questions:
- How will the author adjust to the potential loss of anonymity and the resulting changes in his practice and blogging approach?
- Will the author face any further harassment or backlash from the New York Times or anyone else?
- How will the author's fans and followers adapt to changes in the blogging platform and potential paywalls?
